KH.content: speculative dialectics inscribes mythic thought in a teleological perspective
KH.linkedContent: speculative dialectics inscribes mythic thought in a teleological perspective

KH.content: sublates mythemes into philosophemes: is and is not a logic of noncontradiction
KH.linkedContent: sublates mythemes into philosophemes: is and is not a logic of noncontradiction

KH.content: mytheme, acc. Hegel, will have been a prephilosopheme promised to a dialectical Aufhebung > teleological future anterior resembles narrative while marking end of narrative fiction
KH.linkedContent: mytheme, acc. Hegel, will have been a prephilosopheme promised to a dialectical Aufhebung > teleological future anterior resembles narrative while marking end of narrative fiction

OOG.content: what must be called the dialectic of protention and retention despite Husserl’s repugnance for that word
OOG.linkedContent: what must be called the dialectic of protention and retention despite Husserl’s repugnance for that word

OOG.content: movement of primordial temporalization (protention, retention) was, as every dialectic wants, a dialectic in to nondialectical (the Living Present, universal form of all consciousness)
OOG.linkedContent: movement of primordial temporalization (protention, retention) was, as every dialectic wants, a dialectic in to nondialectical (the Living Present, universal form of all consciousness)

SPOM.content: “multiple” and “at once,” the sign of contradiction w/out contradiction, of non-dialectical or “almost” non-dialectical difference running through every injunction
SPOM.linkedContent: “multiple” and “at once,” the sign of contradiction w/out contradiction, of non-dialectical or “almost” non-dialectical difference running through every injunction

SPOM.content: logic of ghost, toward a thinking of event, exceeds binary, dialectical logic where effectivity or actuality (present, empirical, or not) is opposed to ideality (regulating or absolute non-presence)
SPOM.linkedContent: logic of ghost, toward a thinking of event, exceeds binary, dialectical logic where effectivity or actuality (present, empirical, or not) is opposed to ideality (regulating or absolute non-presence)

SPOM.content: spectral effect, for Marx, a dialectical position (Setzung) of the ghostly body as body proper > where Stirner sees 1st moment as spectral and 2nd as successful, interiorization, subjectivation (plus de vie) Marx sees a hyperbolic surplus of spectrality (plus de mort)
SPOM.linkedContent: spectral effect, for Marx, a dialectical position (Setzung) of the ghostly body as body proper > where Stirner sees 1st moment as spectral and 2nd as successful, interiorization, subjectivation (plus de vie) Marx sees a hyperbolic surplus of spectrality (plus de mort)

HASD.content: a dénégation prior to Freudian context, secret of denial, a negativity that de-negates itself, gives no chance to dialectic
HASD.linkedContent: a dénégation prior to Freudian context, secret of denial, a negativity that de-negates itself, gives no chance to dialectic

MPM.content: the undecidable that resists non-dialectizable oppositions will bear name, maintain rhetorical relation w/ opposition, will have figure of opposition, be figurable, will always let itself by parasited by figure of opposition [thus staging of promise as act or position]
MPM.linkedContent: the undecidable that resists non-dialectizable oppositions will bear name, maintain rhetorical relation w/ opposition, will have figure of opposition, be figurable, will always let itself by parasited by figure of opposition [thus staging of promise as act or position]

A.content: nonpassive endurance of aporia: condition of responsibility, neither dialectizable contradiction like Hegel, Marx nor transcendental illusion like Kant
A.linkedContent: nonpassive endurance of aporia: condition of responsibility, neither dialectizable contradiction like Hegel, Marx nor transcendental illusion like Kant

PP.content: pharmakon is but a formula learned by heart, dead, rigid knowledge shut up (enfermé) in biblia, foreign to living knowledge and dialectic
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon is but a formula learned by heart, dead, rigid knowledge shut up (enfermé) in biblia, foreign to living knowledge and dialectic

PP.content: mimicry of Thoth prevents dialectics, an ironic doubling preventing fulfillment or eschatological reappropriation, he is never present, he invented play, his propriety is impropriety
PP.linkedContent: mimicry of Thoth prevents dialectics, an ironic doubling preventing fulfillment or eschatological reappropriation, he is never present, he invented play, his propriety is impropriety

PP.content: Socratic dialectic as exorcism (training in dialectics), counterspell to free us from fear of death and power of sorcery that banks on such fear
PP.linkedContent: Socratic dialectic as exorcism (training in dialectics), counterspell to free us from fear of death and power of sorcery that banks on such fear

PP.content: in Laws judge must introject, internalize the letter, grammata [tou Dephikou grammatos], into his soul; anamnesic dialectics, repetition of eidos, self-knowledge, self-mastery > a forgetting of childhood, exorcism of child, teaches child to speak
PP.linkedContent: in Laws judge must introject, internalize the letter, grammata [tou Dephikou grammatos], into his soul; anamnesic dialectics, repetition of eidos, self-knowledge, self-mastery > a forgetting of childhood, exorcism of child, teaches child to speak

PP.content: what species of protection (amuntērion) is the dialectic? counter-poison that’s not antidote [?] > acc. Plato’s Stranger, 2 forms of artificial (poiein, protection), of the 2nd form: 1) antidote either human or divine 2) problēmata (shield, fence), either armaments or fences, fences (clôtures, phragmata) can be screens (alexētēria) or protections, finally garments, art of weaving: problematic space of protection
PP.linkedContent: what species of protection (amuntērion) is the dialectic? counter-poison that’s not antidote [?] > acc. Plato’s Stranger, 2 forms of artificial (poiein, protection), of the 2nd form: 1) antidote either human or divine 2) problēmata (shield, fence), either armaments or fences, fences (clôtures, phragmata) can be screens (alexētēria) or protections, finally garments, art of weaving: problematic space of protection

PP.content: [anamnesic] dialectic as antidoteness of antidote, passage btwn human & divine, before their division, also dialectic as science of sumplokē [see p. 67], art of weaving (tissage), if there are 2 sorts of texture
PP.linkedContent: [anamnesic] dialectic as antidoteness of antidote, passage btwn human & divine, before their division, also dialectic as science of sumplokē [see p. 67], art of weaving (tissage), if there are 2 sorts of texture

PP.content: dialectical inversion of pharmakon or dangerous supplement makes death à la fois acceptable and null > immortality of soul, acts like antibody, dissipates its terrifying fantasy, le pharmarkon inverti, qui met en fuite tous les épouvantails: origin of epistēmē, opening to truth as possibility of repetition, submission of “greed for life (epithumein zēn)” to law (king, father, chief, capital)
PP.linkedContent: dialectical inversion of pharmakon or dangerous supplement makes death à la fois acceptable and null > immortality of soul, acts like antibody, dissipates its terrifying fantasy, le pharmarkon inverti, qui met en fuite tous les épouvantails: origin of epistēmē, opening to truth as possibility of repetition, submission of “greed for life (epithumein zēn)” to law (king, father, chief, capital)

PP.content: eidos, truth, law, epistēmē, dialectics, philosophy: names of the pharmakon that must oppose to pharmakon of Sophists, the bewitching fear of death
PP.linkedContent: eidos, truth, law, epistēmē, dialectics, philosophy: names of the pharmakon that must oppose to pharmakon of Sophists, the bewitching fear of death

PP.content: Socrates must listen to the Laws like they’re a phonic spell
PP.linkedContent: Socrates must listen to the Laws like they’re a phonic spell

PP.content: pharmakon is “ambivalent,” from out of its reserve, dans son ombre et sa veille indécises, opposites are opposed, carved out (découper), crosses borders of dualities, it is the movement, locus of play: (the production of) difference, differance of difference, before opposites, not the punctual simplicity of a coincidentia oppositorum [dialectics], fonds sans fond, exceeds, nothing in itself
PP.linkedContent: pharmakon is “ambivalent,” from out of its reserve, dans son ombre et sa veille indécises, opposites are opposed, carved out (découper), crosses borders of dualities, it is the movement, locus of play: (the production of) difference, differance of difference, before opposites, not the punctual simplicity of a coincidentia oppositorum [dialectics], fonds sans fond, exceeds, nothing in itself

PP.content: Plato moves dividing line btwn presence and trace (ikhnos) to dialectical trace and nondialectical trace: good play and bad play
PP.linkedContent: Plato moves dividing line btwn presence and trace (ikhnos) to dialectical trace and nondialectical trace: good play and bad play

PP.content: [stranger (from Sophist) as first grammatologist?] grammar and dialectics can only be distinguished when truth is fully present, fills logos > but parricide in Sophist (impossibility of presence) establishes condition of discourse as diacritical principle of sumplokē ——necessity of logos as necessity of parricide > absolute pre-condition crossed out by parricide at point of its arche-being—prevents difference btwn grammar and ontology
PP.linkedContent: [stranger (from Sophist) as first grammatologist?] grammar and dialectics can only be distinguished when truth is fully present, fills logos > but parricide in Sophist (impossibility of presence) establishes condition of discourse as diacritical principle of sumplokē ——necessity of logos as necessity of parricide > absolute pre-condition crossed out by parricide at point of its arche-being—prevents difference btwn grammar and ontology

PP.content: transmission of dialectical mastery of pharmaka from father to son disrupted by family scene that constitutes & undermines passage btwn pharmacy & house
PP.linkedContent: transmission of dialectical mastery of pharmaka from father to son disrupted by family scene that constitutes & undermines passage btwn pharmacy & house

PAS.content: no circulation, no dialectic, can close itself (se refermer) on (sur) a determinable quantity of forces
PAS.linkedContent: no circulation, no dialectic, can close itself (se refermer) on (sur) a determinable quantity of forces

PAS.content: (transgressive, completely passive) pas enacts a crossing of border that leaves border unscathed (indemne): bord sans bord, w/out any dialectical reappropriation
PAS.linkedContent: (transgressive, completely passive) pas enacts a crossing of border that leaves border unscathed (indemne): bord sans bord, w/out any dialectical reappropriation

PAS.content: ne-pas, not negation brought to bear on a position or a negation, but on “singular undecidability of the approach of the other”—unable to go nearer or father: suffice to disable every dialectical schema
PAS.linkedContent: ne-pas, not negation brought to bear on a position or a negation, but on “singular undecidability of the approach of the other”—unable to go nearer or father: suffice to disable every dialectical schema

VP.content: [rare occasion where “dialectic” is compared to differance] “dialectic” opens living to differance, hiatus (of indication and signification) in pure immanence of lived-experience
VP.linkedContent: [rare occasion where “dialectic” is compared to differance] “dialectic” opens living to differance, hiatus (of indication and signification) in pure immanence of lived-experience

S.content: acc. Valéry, spirit is negative dialectics, “always says no,” and to itself, spirit opposed to life/nature [Nietzsche-like]
S.linkedContent: acc. Valéry, spirit is negative dialectics, “always says no,” and to itself, spirit opposed to life/nature [Nietzsche-like]

POOF.content: perhaps as non-dialectical passage from one to other that Aristotle can’t think, unable to endure contamination coming from what is beyond both antithetical values > Nietzsche: “Glaube an die Gegensatze der Werthe (faith in antithetical values)”
POOF.linkedContent: perhaps as non-dialectical passage from one to other that Aristotle can’t think, unable to endure contamination coming from what is beyond both antithetical values > Nietzsche: “Glaube an die Gegensatze der Werthe (faith in antithetical values)”

POOF.content: via name ‘Aristotle,’ doesn’t dream of an unusable friendship survive? beyond fatal syntheses or reconciliations of dialectics [the worst?] > this inflexible hyperbole of philía is not some indestructible, rigid, resistant solidity, sa vulnérabilité légère ne donnerait prise à aucun retournement [for any dialectical opposition]: a politics that would break from the old, tired, tiring, exhausted history: la belle tentation of the book you’re reading
POOF.linkedContent: via name ‘Aristotle,’ doesn’t dream of an unusable friendship survive? beyond fatal syntheses or reconciliations of dialectics [the worst?] > this inflexible hyperbole of philía is not some indestructible, rigid, resistant solidity, sa vulnérabilité légère ne donnerait prise à aucun retournement [for any dialectical opposition]: a politics that would break from the old, tired, tiring, exhausted history: la belle tentation of the book you’re reading

POOF.content: one must resist the temptation to keep (garder) its chance, never let it become program, never a grounding on virtue of perhaps
POOF.linkedContent: one must resist the temptation to keep (garder) its chance, never let it become program, never a grounding on virtue of perhaps

TC.content: dialectics is that which has finished all of us (nous a perdus), because it takes into account our rejection of it
TC.linkedContent: dialectics is that which has finished all of us (nous a perdus), because it takes into account our rejection of it

TC.content: dialectics as economy of repetition, economy of truth, movement by which expenditure is reappropriated into presence [Being and dialectics? eternal repetition]
TC.linkedContent: dialectics as economy of repetition, economy of truth, movement by which expenditure is reappropriated into presence [Being and dialectics? eternal repetition]

TC.content: following Artaud, Derrida describes a dialectic outside conventional Hegelianism > the indefinite movement of finitude, original repetition, origin of tragedy as absence of simple origin: dialectics as tragedy, only possible affirmation to be made against [Christian] idea of pure origin
TC.linkedContent: following Artaud, Derrida describes a dialectic outside conventional Hegelianism > the indefinite movement of finitude, original repetition, origin of tragedy as absence of simple origin: dialectics as tragedy, only possible affirmation to be made against [Christian] idea of pure origin

PPHS.content: Hegel: in the dialectic a thing can have its cessation (Vergehen) by another, in another
PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: in the dialectic a thing can have its cessation (Vergehen) by another, in another

PPHS.content: “is dialectics the resolution of the sign in the horizon of the nonsign, of the presence beyond the sign?”
PPHS.linkedContent: “is dialectics the resolution of the sign in the horizon of the nonsign, of the presence beyond the sign?”

SH.content: ellipsis, discontinuity, caesura, discretion cannot be sublated (aufgehoben) > no dialectic of sense-certainty can reassure the matter of archive’s safekeeping
SH.linkedContent: ellipsis, discontinuity, caesura, discretion cannot be sublated (aufgehoben) > no dialectic of sense-certainty can reassure the matter of archive’s safekeeping

SH.content: gift of the poem, and of the date: no dialectic
SH.linkedContent: gift of the poem, and of the date: no dialectic

DS.content: book is a dialogue or dialectic, our soul resembles a book when we talk to ourselves, a false dialogue, w/out voice, deficient logos [compare to Husserl’s Bedeutung]
DS.linkedContent: book is a dialogue or dialectic, our soul resembles a book when we talk to ourselves, a false dialogue, w/out voice, deficient logos [compare to Husserl’s Bedeutung]

DS.content: Mallarmé is more patient, subtle, discreet, efficient, does not suppress the double (make it dialectical, bringing us back to presence, to perception of the thing itself)
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé is more patient, subtle, discreet, efficient, does not suppress the double (make it dialectical, bringing us back to presence, to perception of the thing itself)

DS.content: dialectic is beginning and end of philosophy, Mallarmé marks it w/ his syntax at the point of its sterility [MOP] > a point that will be called, analogically, provisionally, undecidable
DS.linkedContent: dialectic is beginning and end of philosophy, Mallarmé marks it w/ his syntax at the point of its sterility [MOP] > a point that will be called, analogically, provisionally, undecidable

DS.content: dialectical structure can’t account for graphics of hymen, is itself comprehended and inscribed w/in latter, separated from it only by itself, a simple veil that constitutes the very thing that tries to reduce it to nothing: desire
DS.linkedContent: dialectical structure can’t account for graphics of hymen, is itself comprehended and inscribed w/in latter, separated from it only by itself, a simple veil that constitutes the very thing that tries to reduce it to nothing: desire

OS.content: dialectical negativity would just renew Hegel’s vulgar concept of time, retain an “other present,” and isn’t this already what Hegel wished to do > the question is of something tout autre
OS.linkedContent: dialectical negativity would just renew Hegel’s vulgar concept of time, retain an “other present,” and isn’t this already what Hegel wished to do > the question is of something tout autre

OS.content: [Hegelian] dialectics as simply a repetition of the [Aristotle’s] exoteric aporia, time becomes affirmation of the aporetic
OS.linkedContent: [Hegelian] dialectics as simply a repetition of the [Aristotle’s] exoteric aporia, time becomes affirmation of the aporetic

ROP.content: Giusti: for Aristotle, art of dialectic is the exercise of dialogue w/ tradition [?]
ROP.linkedContent: Giusti: for Aristotle, art of dialectic is the exercise of dialogue w/ tradition [?]

ROP.content: royal weaver (le tisserand royal) of Platonic dialectic (then Aristotle, Hegel, Kant), belongs to order of ideational consciousness, cannot intervene to remove resistance of any sort
ROP.linkedContent: royal weaver (le tisserand royal) of Platonic dialectic (then Aristotle, Hegel, Kant), belongs to order of ideational consciousness, cannot intervene to remove resistance of any sort

ROP.content: a third path that breaks symbolic, dialectical pact (authority of the 3), that would not be a third path: the square as that which most radically resists, un dernier carré
ROP.linkedContent: a third path that breaks symbolic, dialectical pact (authority of the 3), that would not be a third path: the square as that which most radically resists, un dernier carré

OTO.content: Nietzsche: dialectic is a symptom of decadence, especially in Socrates
OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche: dialectic is a symptom of decadence, especially in Socrates

PS.content: for Foucault, “dialectic,” via rapid oscillations, makes this rapid movement [btwn example & essence] seem to disappear
PS.linkedContent: for Foucault, “dialectic,” via rapid oscillations, makes this rapid movement [btwn example & essence] seem to disappear

O.content: no speculative dialectic of same and other can master “difference” (economy of mark-erasure, trace) because such dialectic always remains an operation of mastery
O.linkedContent: no speculative dialectic of same and other can master “difference” (economy of mark-erasure, trace) because such dialectic always remains an operation of mastery

O.content: avancer qu’il n’y a pas de hors-texte absolu, ce n’est pas postuler une immanence idéale > not an idealist/theological operation, le texte affirme le dehors, deconstructs & reduces predicates of speculative operation (appropriation of outside) to “effects”
O.linkedContent: avancer qu’il n’y a pas de hors-texte absolu, ce n’est pas postuler une immanence idéale > not an idealist/theological operation, le texte affirme le dehors, deconstructs & reduces predicates of speculative operation (appropriation of outside) to “effects”

O.content: Derrida not disputing la raison elle-même, the one (masculine) libido—“why not?” > to stand on head [call for feminine libido?] would put back/leave in place truth of phallocentric dialectic
O.linkedContent: Derrida not disputing la raison elle-même, the one (masculine) libido—“why not?” > to stand on head [call for feminine libido?] would put back/leave in place truth of phallocentric dialectic

O.content: signifier sublated in process of meaning (the signified) > Hegel’s dialectic
O.linkedContent: signifier sublated in process of meaning (the signified) > Hegel’s dialectic

Gi.content: to interpret as negative forces [re: Heidegger’s essential properties of Dasein]: precipitate interpretation, dialecticize
Gi.linkedContent: to interpret as negative forces [re: Heidegger’s essential properties of Dasein]: precipitate interpretation, dialecticize

DST.content: Derrida says that no dialectic can overcome (ne saurait venir à bout) double constraint, double law, that of knot & caesura, obligation & cut (i.e. rhythm) > but then wonders if double bind is too dialectical, so he thinks of an arrythmic gap, hiatus, caesura, another undecidable ——un autre indécidable, the gap/hiatus in an undecidable derived from dialectical calculation/contraction, arrhythmic caesura as respiration of rhythm (this necessity awaits us) [pas, heartbeat]
DST.linkedContent: Derrida says that no dialectic can overcome (ne saurait venir à bout) double constraint, double law, that of knot & caesura, obligation & cut (i.e. rhythm) > but then wonders if double bind is too dialectical, so he thinks of an arrythmic gap, hiatus, caesura, another undecidable ——un autre indécidable, the gap/hiatus in an undecidable derived from dialectical calculation/contraction, arrhythmic caesura as respiration of rhythm (this necessity awaits us) [pas, heartbeat]

TR.content: Derrida not sure if Marx’s thought and his heritage can be reduced to dialectic (from which de Man would distinguish the eventness of the event)
TR.linkedContent: Derrida not sure if Marx’s thought and his heritage can be reduced to dialectic (from which de Man would distinguish the eventness of the event)

EL.content: what if there were no third language, no metalinguistic referee, no language in general, no [originary] neutral language? > what if the dialectico-transcendental hypothesis is already a positivist naturalization/neutralization of the supernatural?
EL.linkedContent: what if there were no third language, no metalinguistic referee, no language in general, no [originary] neutral language? > what if the dialectico-transcendental hypothesis is already a positivist naturalization/neutralization of the supernatural?

HST.content: “the entire contradiction” more than a dialectical one: each concept hospitable to an other that never was “its other” (dialectical contradiction): autodeconstruction in every concept undoes the grip, the violence of taking, Begriff, capture, comprendre, cum-capio ——the difference btwn extending hospitality to one’s chosen other (integratable immigrants), and a tout autre (absolute surprise, madness of the concept of hospitality, atopos)
HST.linkedContent: “the entire contradiction” more than a dialectical one: each concept hospitable to an other that never was “its other” (dialectical contradiction): autodeconstruction in every concept undoes the grip, the violence of taking, Begriff, capture, comprendre, cum-capio ——the difference btwn extending hospitality to one’s chosen other (integratable immigrants), and a tout autre (absolute surprise, madness of the concept of hospitality, atopos)

HST.content: Levinas: “I” does not endow itself w/ this [temporal] alterity: impossibility of dialectical time is impossibility of saving oneself by oneself (alone)
HST.linkedContent: Levinas: “I” does not endow itself w/ this [temporal] alterity: impossibility of dialectical time is impossibility of saving oneself by oneself (alone)

LI.content: permanence depends on dialectical opposition of presence/absence > differential structure of iteration escapes this logic
LI.linkedContent: permanence depends on dialectical opposition of presence/absence > differential structure of iteration escapes this logic

TN.content: you, metronome of my heteronomy, you resist my dreams of a reappropriating movement of self-presence, self-consciousness, absolute knowledge, which is why I love you, so painfully, at heart of pleasure itself
TN.linkedContent: you, metronome of my heteronomy, you resist my dreams of a reappropriating movement of self-presence, self-consciousness, absolute knowledge, which is why I love you, so painfully, at heart of pleasure itself

TN.content: you break me from dialectic (which does not exclude it)
TN.linkedContent: you break me from dialectic (which does not exclude it)

ATM.content: [re: Levinas’ sériature] cette reprise (this mending resumption) is the condition by which beyond essence keeps (garde) its chance [see p. 160] against the enveloping seam (couture enveloppante) of the dialectic or thematic
ATM.linkedContent: [re: Levinas’ sériature] cette reprise (this mending resumption) is the condition by which beyond essence keeps (garde) its chance [see p. 160] against the enveloping seam (couture enveloppante) of the dialectic or thematic

AD.content: how Levinas upsets (dérange) the dialectical affiliation of subject/predicate
AD.linkedContent: how Levinas upsets (dérange) the dialectical affiliation of subject/predicate

WOG.content: under the sign of difference (Foucault, Deleuze too), ‘We Other Greeks’ displaced/deformed (not reversed) an inherited dialecticism that had a Platonic origin before Hegelian, Marxist dialectic
WOG.linkedContent: under the sign of difference (Foucault, Deleuze too), ‘We Other Greeks’ displaced/deformed (not reversed) an inherited dialecticism that had a Platonic origin before Hegelian, Marxist dialectic

WOG.content: the remainder (of all ontology) and the contamination btwn tout autre and its regular reappropriation (economic redialectization) haunts all Derrida’s essays on the Greeks
WOG.linkedContent: the remainder (of all ontology) and the contamination btwn tout autre and its regular reappropriation (economic redialectization) haunts all Derrida’s essays on the Greeks

WOG.content: the non-discursive remainder, the resistance of the pharmakon, exceeds (is not only) the simulacrum or phantasm—whose repetition disorganizes dialectic
WOG.linkedContent: the non-discursive remainder, the resistance of the pharmakon, exceeds (is not only) the simulacrum or phantasm—whose repetition disorganizes dialectic

LG.content: [re: Blanchot’s La folie du jour] récit in récit > non-inclusive, so remote from dialectic that this structure inscribes dialectic in ellipsis of récit
LG.linkedContent: [re: Blanchot’s La folie du jour] récit in récit > non-inclusive, so remote from dialectic that this structure inscribes dialectic in ellipsis of récit

OG.content: for Saussure & Husserl, teleology of phonetic writing makes the crisis of nonphonetic writing psychological errors, these nonintutionisms exile from sense; for Husserl, unlike Saussure, empty formalism part of his teleology > dialectical use of negativity should force us to rethink crisis (crisis not a mere accident)
OG.linkedContent: for Saussure & Husserl, teleology of phonetic writing makes the crisis of nonphonetic writing psychological errors, these nonintutionisms exile from sense; for Husserl, unlike Saussure, empty formalism part of his teleology > dialectical use of negativity should force us to rethink crisis (crisis not a mere accident)

OG.content: Rousseau says what he doesn’t wish to say: graphics of supplementarity is not comprised in any dialectic (a concept governed by horizon of presence, eschatological parousia, parole pleine)
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau says what he doesn’t wish to say: graphics of supplementarity is not comprised in any dialectic (a concept governed by horizon of presence, eschatological parousia, parole pleine)

OG.content: though Rousseau doesn’t make “travail de la mort,” play of difference, & operation of negativity serve in dialectical accomplishment of Hegel’s truth w/in horizon of parousia > still, a horizon of infinite restitution of presence [in Rousseau]
OG.linkedContent: though Rousseau doesn’t make “travail de la mort,” play of difference, & operation of negativity serve in dialectical accomplishment of Hegel’s truth w/in horizon of parousia > still, a horizon of infinite restitution of presence [in Rousseau]

IF.content: Flaubert like Mallarmé: inscribed in locus of philosophical exhaustion, simulacrum of dialectic, both expose its limits & impossibility > simulacrum that discredits oppositions (both mimic Platonic-Hegelian Idea while emptying it of its metaphysical/dialectic content)
IF.linkedContent: Flaubert like Mallarmé: inscribed in locus of philosophical exhaustion, simulacrum of dialectic, both expose its limits & impossibility > simulacrum that discredits oppositions (both mimic Platonic-Hegelian Idea while emptying it of its metaphysical/dialectic content)

EU.content: king: someone who makes you learn his language, in learning it, you countersign his force: power demonstrated through fact of translation > this is a paradigmatic event, not structural necessity of master-slave dialectic
EU.linkedContent: king: someone who makes you learn his language, in learning it, you countersign his force: power demonstrated through fact of translation > this is a paradigmatic event, not structural necessity of master-slave dialectic

EU.content: can only say “I want to speak my mother tongue” in language of the king
EU.linkedContent: can only say “I want to speak my mother tongue” in language of the king

SPEC.content: dialectics acquits itself [allays uneasiness] of double, opposes mask to original “in person”
SPEC.linkedContent: dialectics acquits itself [allays uneasiness] of double, opposes mask to original “in person”

FV.content: acc. Lacan, the [full] speech which constitutes/forms the subject is forbidden to him > it speaks everywhere it can be read in his Being [this antinomy is very antinomy of the meaning Freud gave to unconscious]: true speech always operates through mediation of another subject, it is open to chain w/out end re: speeches in which dialectic of recognition is concretely realized in human community [?]
FV.linkedContent: acc. Lacan, the [full] speech which constitutes/forms the subject is forbidden to him > it speaks everywhere it can be read in his Being [this antinomy is very antinomy of the meaning Freud gave to unconscious]: true speech always operates through mediation of another subject, it is open to chain w/out end re: speeches in which dialectic of recognition is concretely realized in human community [?]

CHOR.content: when sexual difference is determined by opposition, acc. Hegelian dialectics, destines sexual difference for truth—in order to erase/neutralize sexual difference [in masculine sex?]
CHOR.linkedContent: when sexual difference is determined by opposition, acc. Hegelian dialectics, destines sexual difference for truth—in order to erase/neutralize sexual difference [in masculine sex?]
